Acts as HRBP for one or more departments and advices based on understanding of business needs. Challenge, advise and act upon business developments, strategy and people & organization related issues or needs. Works directly with the managers to develop and direct an HR agenda that closely supports the organizational goals. Acts as the integrator between the business and the HR organization.

Role and responsibilities
Develops and implements near-term human resources plans that are effective in addressing organization issues and are consistent with business goals.
Involve in developing and managing workforce plan, support line manager to work with Business leaders to develop and meet the plan objectives.
Develop and deploy employee engagement initiatives, and implement retention strategies
Support to boost a high-performing culture by providing coaching and interventions with the business leaders and individuals, particularly around performance improvement, engagement, and team effectiveness.

Degree in Business, Human Resources, or related discipline
3 to 5 years of relevant HRBP experience,  8+ years of progressive work experience in Human Resources.

job_name: Manufacturing - Operational Supply Management Specialist - Tainan - J-00253644-922
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
The Operation Supply Management (OSM) department is within Supply Chain Management. This department is responsible for several logistic activities and material planning. This is a project-based position toward SCM to optimize process.

Role and responsibilities
1. Eligible for leading projects with logistic or materials planning scope.
2. Coordination and completion of projects on time within framing and within scope.
3. Set deadlines, assign responsibilities, monitor and summarize progress of project of own business scope.
4. Presenting updating reports for all stakeholders regarding status of projects.

1. Determine and define project scope and objectives.
2. Reserve resources needed to reach objectives and manage resources in an effective and efficient manner.
3. Develop and manage a detailed project schedule, work plan, and strategy.
4. Presenting project updates on a consistent basis to various stakeholders about strategy, adjustments, and progress agreement to documentation.  
5. Collaboration and fluent English communication skills between multiple departments are highly needed.
6. Be able to motivate and guide team member with stressful situations.
7. Optimistically deal with and tackle challenges step by step.

Education and experience
Master Degree / 5 year experience in supply chain related function

Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

1. Achieved, proven worldwide project management cases in fluent English for implementation, plan, and completion. 
2. Experiencing projects in full life cycle management or supply chain management.
3. Lean management or Lean project experience is preferred.
4. SAP or Oracle operation experience for material module/production module is preferred.

Diversity & Inclusion

It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. Supply allocation to maintain high fulfillment rate for demand.
Others, project.

Good communication skills ( verbal and written); able to work collaboratively with different departments
Strong soft skills including Powerpoint and Excel.

Team player who is able to convince others with various cultural backgrounds.

job_name: D&E - Senior Industrialization Engineer (IE CS/APPS/SW) - Tainan - J-00265676-063
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
ASML Taiwan, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop SEM based wafer inspection machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 4 office locations around Taiwan including offices in Linkou, Hsinchu, Taichung and Tainan.

Role and responsibilities
The mission of the Industrial Engineer is to enable our factory and field service engineers to be successful in supporting our customers. As an expert in your subsystem you will function as the technical interface between our manufacturing department in Tainan, local Customer Support (CS) organizations and ASML Headquarters in Netherlands and San Jose.

As an Industrial Engineer you will be responsible for the preparation for the service processes including all required installation, test and service procedures, training documentation, definition of out of control action plans, diagnostics, Statistical Process Control parameters, tooling and spare parts
New product introduction by validating service procedures during prototype build, training our service personnel and supporting them during early customer introduction phase. If needed travel to solve complex problems on site within expertise (international travel max 10%)
Analysis of the performance in our service organization and define improvements to meet initial product specification

Education and experience
Master or higher degree in technical science (mechanical, mechatronics, physics, electronics, material science, optics, software) or equivalent experience. Or bachelor’s degree with at least 3-7 years relevant work experience.

3-7 years or more (co-op included) of experience in:
A production and/or service environment with high tech products and complex production processes
Background in software and software lifecycle is a plus.
Knowledge of complex SEM systems is a plus
Working experience or knowledge in semiconductor equipment as well as understanding the concept of CRAMS (cost, reliability, availability, manufacturability, serviceability) is required
A background in the application of charged optical optics, high voltage, charged particle physics, vacuum systems and semiconductor fabs is desired

Skills

To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

Can observe and respond to people and situations and interact with others encountered during work.
Can learn and apply new information or skills.
Must be able to read and interpret data, information, and documents. Interpret and update Gantt charts. Understand basic project planning, dependencies, and milestones
Strong customer focus and commitment to customer satisfaction through prioritization, quality, efficiency and professionalism.
Ability to complete assignments with attention to detail and high degree of accuracy.
Proven ability to perform effectively in a demanding environment with changing workloads.
Result driven-demonstrate ownership and accountability.
Identifies bottlenecks and drives improvements.
Work independently or as part of a team and follow through on assignments with minimal supervision.
Demonstrate open, clear, concise and professional communication.
Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with co-workers and customer.
Work according to a strict set of procedures within the provided timelines.

job_name: CS - DUV Customer Support Engineer - Tainan - J-00265775-115
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction
Within ASML the sector Customer Support (CS) is responsible for the maintenance, repair and continuous improvement of ASML systems at customer locations.
One of the departments in this sector is CS HVM. The CS HVM team prepares and manages the CS part of the execution of new system maintenance of new ASML machines at customer sites. These Installations are done in close cooperation with Field Factory System Install Engineering (FF SIE)  in shift schedules at customer production environment over a period of 3-4 months.

Job Mission
- The Customer Support Organization is responsible for the installation, qualification, repair and maintenance of the ASML systems at the customer site and is responsible for the necessary transfer of know-how to the customer. 
- The Customer Support Engineer (CSE), an ambassador for ASML, must be the first line of support for the repair and maintenance of the ASML Systems. 
- The CSE will interface with the customers, peers, local 2nd line support and staff management to assure timely and accurate support. 
- The CSE must be able to clearly communicate between key stakeholders of technical, organizational and operational stakeholders in relation to driving availability to their specific
customer.

Job Description
- Analyzes, diagnoses, and troubleshoots equipment problems via telephone or at customer site.
- Performs installation, repair, retrofits, upgrades and preventive maintenance on equipment installed at customer sites.
- Regularly provides assistance, guidance, leadership, and technical assistance to junior or less experienced field service engineers; may serve as site leader for customer.
- Maintains and manages an assigned installation equipment base. This includes providing primary support, forecasting, conducting customer support meetings, and ensuring regular communication with the customer.
- Assists customers in the receipt, installation, and testing of company equipment.
- Conducts equipment troubleshooting, analysis, and debugging in support of installation or operating activities.
- Provides service education to customer’s service and operations staff.
- Ensures that parts are available and as specified for service requirements.
- Maintains appropriate tools are on hand and as required.
- Travels as required for the purposes of performing service activities at customer sites or backfilling for other Field Service Engineers.
- Completes service, expense reports, and other administrative responsibilities in accordance with procedures and with supervisor’s approval.
- Uses company technical documentation and provides feedback for improvement.
- Performs other duties as assigned.

Education
BS/MS major in Mechanical, Electrical/ Electro-optical, Controlling Engineering, Physics or other related fields

Experience
- Fab experience in the Lithography area will be a plus
- Experience or knowledge of semiconductor manufacturing process is preferred

Personal skills
- Good communication skills and command of the English Language
- Must be a strong team player, supporting & analytical skill and good working habits

Context of the position
At customer sites / office

job_name: Cymer - Field Service Engineer - Tainan - J-00257299-550
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
Provides onsite field service support through the performance of installations, upgrades, repairs, and maintenance of complex capital equipment and systems.  Troubleshoots either to resolve issues directly or through referring advanced issues to technical support resources.  Acts as a customer service advocate, instructing customers in the operation and maintenance of the system.

Role and responsibilities
•Analyzes, diagnoses, and troubleshoots Cymer equipment problems via telephone or at customer site.
•Performs installation, repair, retrofits, upgrades and preventive maintenance on Cymer equipment installed at customer sites.
•Maintains and manages an assigned installation equipment base.  This includes providing primary support, forecasting, conducting customer support meetings, and ensuring regular communication with the customer.
•Assists customers in the receipt, installation, and testing of company equipment.
•Conducts equipment troubleshooting, analysis, and debugging in support of installation or operating activities.
•Provides service education to customer’s service and operations staff.
•Ensures that parts are available and as specified for service requirements.
•Maintains appropriate tools are on hand and as required.
•Travels as required for the purposes of performing service activities at customer sites or backfilling for other Cymer Field Service Engineers.
•Completes service, expense reports, and other administrative responsibilities in accordance with Cymer’s procedures and with supervisor’s approval.
•Uses company technical documentation and provides feedback for improvement.
•Performs other duties as assigned.

Education and experience
Requires an Associate’s Degree with a technical emphasis and a minimum of four (4) year’s of field service engineering experience or a Bachelor’s Degree in a technical field with two (2) years of field service engineering experience.

•Minimum of one (1) year experience in optics, laser, and/or semiconductor manufacturing equipment experience is preferred.
•Laser and vacuum experience preferred.
•Has led one installation or significantly contributed to the successful installation of products at multiple sites.
•Requires experience using the following software packages: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, LabView, Internet Protocol, and Computer Networking.

Skills
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

•Good written and verbal communications skills.
•Ability to analyze data and report problems, to complete accurate, comprehensive service reports, and to communicate technical issues to other technical staff. 
•Ability to collect, translate, and analyze data and take action based on effectively report problems though written and/or graphical representation of data (detailed Post-Mortem Chronological Abstracts, trending analysis, failure statistics, etc.).
•Excellent customer service skills, with a solid foundation in and an understanding of the importance of relationship building.
•Intermediate level of technical knowledge of electronics.
•Ability to facilitate resolution of technical challenges.
•Ability to apply advanced knowledge of installation, maintenance/repair, and troubleshooting at both the module and system level, while seeking expertise of more senior field service engineers where required.
•Ability to read and analyze opto-mechanical and electronic schematics.
•Must be able to successfully meet customer site access requirements such as:  background checks, safety training, and cleanroom access (gowning and breathing apparatus).  
•Ability to travel via air and auto approximately 20% of the time. 
•For regions - oral and written English language skills preferred.

cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Role and responsibilities
As a Supply Quality Engineer, you will take a pivotal role as a linking pin between the ASML D&E development team and the related development team of the supplier, with a primary focus on parts quality. You maintains and develops at an operational level the relation to the supplier with the purpose to create an optimal engineering collaboration between supplier and ASML while managing all the critical quality elements of full lifecycle of product from NPI stage to Volume. Using your personal skills, you will work closely together with the supplier & ASML internal stakeholders to optimize the effectiveness and efficiency of the product generation process, in alignment with the ASML project plan. The main goal of this cross-sector activity is to secure an excellent quality of parts delivered by our suppliers.

Within the project the Supply Quality Engineer (SQE) is the primary responsible to ensure parts quality from our suppliers. Using your in-depth technical knowledge, analytic thinking, political antenna and excellent people skills, you work closely with suppliers to build up an intimate knowledge of their IP and technological capabilities.

The main responsibilities are:
•Early supplier involvement in the D&E project to secure that technology expertise of ASML and supplier are merged in the best way.
•Ensure that not only parts quality, however, also manufacturability and serviceability aspects are covered in the design phase.
•Document the D&E project collaboration, including supplier & ASML responsibilities and roles via a Statement of Work (SoW).
•New product introduction (NPI) and supplier selection.
•Deliverables that secure parts quality from suppliers in the ASML product generation process
•Responsible for the entire Quality and Technical process performance for suppliers, including operational interface on deviations from specifications
•Monitor, review and drive supplier quality performance from incidents to structural improvement
•Contribute to supplier development (e.g. implementing SPC, lean, FMEA, operational excellence at suppliers)
•Optimize manufacturing processes at suppliers by improving quality, testing and qualification infrastructure 
•Drive yield and process improvements at suppliers. Actively participate in improvement projects at suppliers (cycle time reduction, cost of goods reduction)
•Carry-out analyses of quality and logistical issues to drive technical solutions needed during material availability escalations
•Support implementation of hardware changes at suppliers


The core competencies are:
•Production process qualification for R4V of mains products (PFMEA)
•Manufacturing conform standards (UL508A).
•Process to maintain and improve products-SPC
•Ability to added value testing strategy (zero NFF)
•Supply chain management / highest reliability
•Technology leadership for the specific (mains)product
•Technology competence/Technical Dev.Comp.(incl. EOL)

Education and experience
BSc or MSc in Mechanical Engineering. 


Broad (at least 5-8 years) experience in high tech environment with a focus on supplier management or part quality or project management in Electro-mechanics engineering. Candidate must be trained and experienced with Quality systems and methods (preferably Six Sigma Green or Black belt), as well as Engineering towards production processes. Specialism in electro-mechanic assemblies.

Skills
The following personal skills are crucial to a successful execution:
• Ability to initiate, influence and steer without formal authority.
• Strong networker with good negotiating and team building skills
• Strong communicator.
• Ability to switch between complex matters and high-level conclusions.
• Self-propelling, showing initiative and drive.
• Flexible, result driven and committed.
• Team player
• Process oriented
• Fluent in English

cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
ASML brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography/E-beam inspection machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler Arizona, San Jose and San Diego California, Wilton Connecticut, and Hillsboro Oregon.

Role and responsibilities
- Mechanical design for machine and manufacture bench from concept to function delivery in ASML way of working.
- Trouble shooting and solution finding for factory and customer related to mechanical issues.
- Finite element analysis and optimum design on structural, thermo, flow and vibration.
- To develop and document mechanical designs for e-beam inspection systems/subsystems from concept to final release.
- To design and modify parts or large scale assemblies using Solidworks/NX.
- To come out related document for manufacturing.
- To define test plans, perform testing and write test reports.
- To transfer design to manufacturing providing necessary documents and trainings.
- To work with outside vendors and consultants to develop, analyze and fabricate components and sub-assemblies.
- To analyze technical issues, to find out root cause and provide practical improvement plan.
- To provide engineer change document and complete process on time.
- To effective communicate with other departments and co-work with other stakeholders all over the world.
- To provide technical support for production and field service engineer.
- To use finite element analysis for structural, thermo, flow and vibration issues and find solutions.

Education and experience
Master(and above)  degree in one of following fields
-Mechanical Engineering
-Automation Engineering
-CAE or FEA engineer
-Other engineering related dept.
Two years or above working experience in mechanical or automation relative design will be preferred.

Skills
- Need have good understanding of physics and mechanics.
- 2D/3D CAD Mechanical design software ability. Solidworks/NX is preferred.
- Knowledge with material and material selection, manufacturing and cleaning processes used for making components for E-beam inspection systems.
- Teamwork spirit with team members. 
- Good communication skill with stakeholders in work.
- Excellent written skill in work related document.
- Be able to read and interpret data, information and document.
- Experience in designing, fabrication, and testing of mechanical, electro-mechanical modules, and related system interfaces for capital equipment tools is preferred.

Specializing in one or more of following fields would be a plus
- With experience of finite element analysis in vibration/structure(ANSYS)/thermo/flow(Comsol)

cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction
Within ASML the Customer Support (CS) group is responsible for the maintenance, repair and continuous improvement of ASML systems at customer locations. One of the departments in this group is EUV install –Upgrade. The organization prepares and executes complex EUV install & upgrades action over ASML EUV systems at various customer worldwide.

Job Mission
Manage and keep leading on complex install sequence and activities, enabling successful install with quality within all sorts of resource budgets,  unlock the potential of ASML EUV products for our customers.

Job Description
• Work safely and meet customers / ASML designated safety rules –regulations at all time
• As Coordinator you will be an ASML ambassador at customer sites across the globe. 
• Run upon shift model, based on BP design and install coordination needs.
• Work with the local and Veldhoven organizations to plan and make all necessary preparations for the on-time execution of the install.

• Identify, document and drive improvements in order to reduce upgrade cycle time.

• This position will require international travel (up to 50%) to the field offices worldwide for EUV install. 

Education
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Technology, Mechatronics, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, and Computer Science. 

Experience
•Experience in a customer support department for high tech products. Photo-lithography, Electro-Mechanical or Ultra Clean Vacuum. 
•Engineers with 2-3 years ASML EUV or NXT `hands-on’ experience is preferred.

Personal skills
• Open for cultural differences.
• Motivated, pro-active, self-driven and flexible. 
• Highly stress-resistant.
• Take the lead during escalations and drive for solutions. 
• Self-sustaining and ability to prioritize activities and coordinate a broad range of specialists, ensuring action plans are carried out.
• Analytical ability.
• Good documentation skills.
• Multitasker with the ability to work in different and difficult working environment. 
• Good team player who is committed to the success of ASML.
• Good customer skills. 
• Good communication skills, verbal and written, in English.

job_name: [ASML研發替代役/預聘] D&E - Mechanical Design Engineer - Tainan - req56259
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
- ASML brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography/E-beam inspection machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven , the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler Arizona, San Jose and San Diego California, Wilton Connecticut, and Hillsboro Oregon.

Role and responsibilities
- Mechanical design for machine and manufacture bench from concept to function delivery in ASML way of working.
- Trouble shooting and solution finding for factory and customer related to mechanical issues.
- Finite element analysis and optimum design on structural, thermo, flow and vibration.
- To develop and document mechanical designs for e-beam inspection systems/subsystems from concept to final release.
- To design and modify parts or large scale assemblies using Solidworks/NX.
- To come out related document for manufacturing.
- To define test plans, perform testing and write test reports.
- To transfer design to manufacturing providing necessary documents and trainings.
- To work with outside vendors and consultants to develop, analyze and fabricate components and sub-assemblies.
- To analyze technical issues, to find out root cause and provide practical improvement plan.
- To provide engineer change document and complete process on time.
- To effective communicate with other departments and co-work with other stakeholders all over the world.
- To provide technical support for production and field service engineer.
- To use finite element analysis for structural, thermo, flow and vibration issues and find solutions.

Education and experience
Master(and above)  degree in one of following fields
-Mechanical Engineering
-Automation Engineering
-CAE or FEA engineer
-Other engineering related dept.
Two years or above working experience in mechanical or automation relative design will be preferred.

Skills

To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

- Need have good understanding of physics and mechanics.
- 2D/3D CAD Mechanical design software ability. Solidworks/NX is preferred.
- Knowledge with material and material selection, manufacturing and cleaning processes used for making components for E-beam inspection systems.
- Teamwork spirit with team members. 
- Good communication skill with stakeholders in work.
- Excellent written skill in work related document.
- Be able to read and interpret data, information and document.
- Experience in designing, fabrication, and testing of mechanical, electro-mechanical modules, and related system interfaces for capital equipment tools is preferred.

Specializing in one or more of following fields would be a plus
- With experience of finite element analysis in vibration/structure(ANSYS)/thermo/flow(Comsol)

• Drive technical, complex and multidisciplinary Projects according to the CRE Building Generation Process (BGP)

ability to handle multiple requests and work on management and operational level.

Execute TNF new plant projects, such as: TN campus , common plate form, SP3, HBS, ICRT expansion, etc. These projects are more than 1M euros and exceeding the workload of the one project leader.

job_name: CS - EUV Technical Training Instructor - Tainan - J-00243615-050
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
This position is within the CS sector. The CS Organization is responsible for the installation, qualification, repair and maintenance of the ASML systems at our customers’ sites and is responsible for the necessary transfer of know-how to the customer. Local Customer Support branches (Field Support) perform these tasks at the customers within their specific region. The training department is the crucial link between the development department and the thousands of colleagues working at customer sites worldwide and engineers in Veldhoven performing this excellent support. The training department develops and delivers technical training through 1000’s of training events yearly worldwide. Most trainees are from the CS and Manufacturing and Logistics (M and L) sectors. The training department has training facilities in Netherlands, Taiwan, Korea and USA.

As a Technical Instructor you will be responsible for delivering high quality technical training to engineers from the CS sector and  to facilitate their learning process. You will also be responsible for facilitating the introduction of issues reported from Customer Support (CS) engineers in the Field in to the training program. You will work closely with training developer (mostly located in NL and US) to  continuously  improve the training curriculum and materials. You will be a member of the CS Training Center Department (~80 employees worldwide). Our Training Centers operate in shifts that include weekends and nights in class and cleanrooms.

Role and responsibilities
You will support the growth to maturity of our field engineers by facilitating the acquisition of critical skills at several levels (basic machine operation, major maintenance and adjustments, troubleshooting and diagnostic).
Also, within our department you work in one or more projects supporting the learning needs of our customers.
Being in touch with several departments (e.g. Manufacturing, Global Support Centre, D & E and CS-FSE) you translate customer requirements into blended learning training packages as part of training material updates and maintenance.

Education and experience
Higher Technical College or (Technical) University (B.Sc./ M.Sc.) in Science field (Electrical
Technology, Mechatronics, Chemistry, Mechanical Engineering, Physics or Computer Science, etc.)

– Experience in training development and delivery, preferably in blended learning packages, or experience in teaching a technical subject.
– A background in field service, system maintenance and / or process engineering in the semiconductor industry is preferred.
- 2 to 3 years of delivering Technical Training with proven affinity with or expertise in education and/or didactics.
- Experience or knowledge of ASML systems is preferred.

Skills
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

- Fluent communication skills in spoken and written English.
- Critical interviewing, coaching and communicative skills.
- Strong interpersonal and facilitation skills.
- Consultancy skills with strong analytical skills.
- Teamwork, planning and organization skills.
- Able to work in shifts that include weekends and nights.
- Able and willing to travel.
- Have a passion for training, teaching and learning.
- Ability for analytical and abstract thinking.
- Business sense for possible new opportunities which add value to our core business.

Diversity & Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

job_name: [ASML研發替代役/預聘] CS - EUV Technical Support Engineer - Tainan - req53684
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
Are you a team player who want to be brilliant and visible in the ASML CS EUV organization? Apply this job to help CS by impressive techniques and communication skills to driving technical containment/solution among local team, GSC and D&E to get the problem solved effectively.

Role and responsibilities
1. Drive escalations efficiently and effectively in Field Technical Support among CS Field site till the issue is resolved.
2. Communicate and strike to multiparty agreement among customer, local team, GSC, and D&E during technical escalation.
3. Help local organization to make concrete problem and help request toward GSC and DnE escalation properly and promptly.
4. Driving with technical containment and solution via escalation channels. Implement as structure improvement to reduce XLD/MTTR/LHM.

1. Contain or solve escalation issues by technical skills with sharply knowledge
2. Ownership:
- Ensure proper feedback, follow-up and closure of escalations in agreement with system leader and section manager
- Be available and flexible for x-site escalation when the need arises
- Engage other competencies / GSC when necessary, in timely manner with clear help request and updated PCCSIM
3. Communication:
- Communicate clearly and in timely manner with correct stakeholder and official tooling (SMS/PCCSIM/… )
- Ensure mandatory verbal communication between GSC sites for critical SO’s
- Organize meeting / conference call between GSC and stakeholders
- Ensure the passdown is clear with actions done / current system states / clear help request towards next shift and/or GSC
4. Quality:
- PCCSIM: Ensure there is a clear problem description, up-to-date Fishbone and TimeLine, Root cause Analysis, Action Plan (based on fishbone), Possible containment, Solution
- Create DFLAP (Deterministic Forward-Looking Action Plan) which includes at least 1-2 levels of ‘what-if’ scenario
- Secure up-to-date PCCSIM, SO status (SMS) and passdown update at day’s end
5. Issue follow up
- Have a “fix once mindset” and take ownership on follow-up actions to empower other fab teams to be self-sufficient
- For each service order you work on, fill-in the SO review (SORT) within 2 weeks after SO closure
- Create deliverables like AIR issue, PCS, Coach comment, etc… for each SO when required
- Provide for each SO escalated to 3rd line the reason to escalate in SORT, like: capability gap, escalation process, structural issue
- Create postmortem / IRP reports for XLD issues (machine down >12hrs)
- Close loop with Service Engineering for Structural AIR issues

Education and experience
Master degree in Science and Engineering (Physics, Mechatronics, Electronics, Chemistry, Aerospace Engineering, Process technology, etc.); or equivalent experience is desired.

At least 2 years of experience within ASML Customer Service or product related engineering position.

Skills
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

1. Able to lead discussion logically and narrow down problems effectively.
2. Proficient and fluent English conversation and presentation ability.
3. Be used to work under multi-culture and nations of environment.
4. High awareness to the life cycle of escalation to drive escalation promptly.
5. Stress resistant and strong leadership to difficult tasks.
6. Multiple tasking and have ability to set the right priority.
7. Capability to identify the stakeholders in the complex working environment.
8. Flexibility for oversea and domestic traveling based on requirement.
9. Prominent communication skill to bridge local team toward GSC and D&E
10. Strong commitment and Leadership with the mindset of NEVER GIVE UP.

cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
Execute strategies to assure "Manufacturing Radiation Machine Permit" could be successfully update and obtain the "e-Beam NPI radiation permit" on time to met the producing schedule. • Protect against the detriment of ionizing radiation, reduce workplace radiation risks and create better, safer, healthier working conditions. • Ensure compliance with radiation protection regulations, and all corporate policies and procedures. • Other management matters related to EHS.

Based on the Taiwan Government Regulations on "Ionizing Radiation Protection", e-Beam is produced at the Tainan factory, which requires an expert with a "radiation protection personnel" license and hired as a fixed ASML employee. 1. The e-Beam machine with voltages >30 kV in which electrons are accelerated (i.e. there is a electron beam) there is a possibly of an ionizing radiation (X ray) safety risk. 2. Based on Taiwan regulations “Ionizing Radiation Protection Act”, we are required to possess a “manufacturing permit” from the Tainan factory, and "radiation protection personnel" license

Role and responsibilities
· Maintain the effectiveness of radiation protection plans, assist in the establishment of safe operating procedures and emergency measures, and supervise implementation;

· Maintain the operation of the Manufacture Radiation Permit system;

· Carry out risk assessments and minimize risk to employees, workers and the environment;

· Plan and supervise the radiation protection management, implement radiation detection of ionizing radiation equipment;

· Report and declare related to radiation protection required to the government;

· Supervise and handle the dose record management of ionizing radiation workers, and the investigation and treatment of overexposure;

· Monitor manufacture operations to identify any design, construction, or operation practices that violate safety regulations and laws;

· Assist in planning health examination of the radiation workers and assist the health management;

· Communicate with Corporate, other regional, and local EHS colleagues on programs implementation and project support;

· OTHER MANAGEMENT MATTERS RELATED TO EHS.

Education and experience
Bachelor / Master

· Taiwan governmental "radiation protection personnel" license. (證照：輻射防護員/輻射防護師) (must necessary condition)

· At least 2 years of radiation protection related work experiences


Skills

To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

· Sustain focus on details for a longer period of time, without increasing the number of mistakes

· Work accurate, careful, exact and check work before delivery

· Show integrity and honesty

· Can cooperate effectively in (multidisciplinary) groups

· Communicate effectively in both Chinese and English

· Act in compliance with procedures

· Involve colleagues in getting things done

· Timely escalate issues

· Express ideas for improvements

· Detail oriented and independent

· Good team player

· Proactive and communicative personality

· Cultural awareness and diplomacy

· Commitment: take ownership and achieve end result

job_name: D&E - Change Specialist - Tainan - J-00265402-158
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
As a Change Specialist working in HMI Configuration Management team, your mission is:
• To enable efficient decision making based on high quality change requests. 
• To embed the configuration change process in HMI organization.
• To ensure that the business is protected against uncontrolled changes.

This position may require access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require the Company to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.

Role and responsibilities
ASML’s technologies require multidisciplinary engineering. Cross-sector teams create change requests based on improvement ideas, problem reports and customer requests. These teams need optimal guidance and coordination. Your job is to steer for a complete impact analysis and business case for each change request. The analysis and business case should cover aspects from engineering, supply chain, ASML factory and customer service. The configuration changes also include implementation strategies through the product life cycle. You will support a multidisciplinary, cross-sector team to create this. Furthermore, you will chair a “change board” meeting with cross-sector representatives, where the prepared change requests are to be discussed and accepted before the work planning will be started. Your tasks will be:


To prepare Change Request with Project team.
Recognize and advise on scope of change requests (scope control, new or update change)
To organize and chair cross sector project change control board for impact analysis, planning and disposition of changes
To prepare meeting agenda and chair the Change Board meeting, managing multiple stakeholders.
Coordinate and coach cross-sector project team on the product change process
Manage quality of impact analysis of changes, to minimize processing time and reliable planning
To manage on clear decision making and decision recording.
To manage on a minimal processing time of any change request, while balancing quality.
Safeguard the Configuration Management policy in daily execution and contribute to continuous improvement
Monitor and control the implementation of approved changes
Monitor and give feedback on changes being processed according agreed CM@ASML policy
Be involved in embedding improvements delivered from CM@ASML roadmap on operational level
Contribute to development of CM@ASML
Other duties as required such as Master data registration, support engineers to upload Data/ Technical Product Document to PLM and ERP system

Education and experience
Bachelor’s degree in industrial / Logistics / Engineering or Technical Business administration.

2+yrs work experience in new product introductions, preferably in semiconductor equipment industry, high-tech, low-volume environment
Experience in organizational change management process, familiar with Product Lifecycle Management and Product Data management
Experience in operations; ability to foresee impact of change (e.g. logistics, operation, customer support)
Proven analytical and conceptual skills combined with business sense
Proven experience in managing multiple changes, configurations and their dependencies
Configuration Management certification is preferred
Proficient with Microsoft Office tools such as Excel, Visio, PowerPoint and share point; direct experience with Arena, Oracle, Teamcenter and SAP is a plus

Skills

Natural leader, outgoing, easy to be approached.
Focus on structure, prioritization and decisiveness, remains persistent until the goal has been reached.
Motivational, energetic, pro-active attitude and drive for improvement
Strong communication and good presentation skills 
Analytical and creative skills.
Eager to learn and able to self-reflect

The role as Value Stream Manager offers the opportunity of combining structural tasks with project management. The Value Stream Manager supports the Value Stream Lead and Business Line in achieving the priorities and objectives by effective stakeholder management towards the sectors and Program Leads, setting up/initiating/leading processes for key decision making, setting up and leading the structure for f.e. breakthrough portfolio management, and/or leading one of the projects from the portfolio. job_detail:
ASML TW, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.

Role and responsibilities

To focus on software product design, you need to communicate with Program and System engineer to define software product functionalities, analysis Application engineer’ s requirements on flow design, software data handling and software application technical roadmap planning guidance. Support functional design and realize the software infrastructure and application future roadmap for the ASML-HMI E-Beam products.

Working closely with customer and application engineering, software application engineer is responsible for developing software application using ASML-HMI e-beam systems to provide monitor and control solution for advanced nodes in semi-conductor industries.
Identify business requirements from product managers or stakeholders for inspection and metrology software development. Meet with internal and external customers to maintain two-way level of commitment to keep all involved and affected parties informed of progress.
Define unified software application development standards and data input/output for EBI tool and software environment selection.
Design, develop, integrate software features for inspection and metrology products.
Perform data analysis with mathematical models and software algorithms on customer data.


Education and experience
MS or PhD in physical sciences, engineering or a related field

Master with 7+ years of years of relevant work experience or PhD
knowledge with Semiconductor manufacturing and process flow.
Expert knowledge in EBI inspection and metrology wafer process application.
Experienced in E-beam tool, such as CDSEM, Review SEM, TEM, etc.
Experienced on yield engineering in Semiconductor industry.
Experience in scripting programming language, data analytical tooling.
Familiar with distributed system and concurrent programming to analyzes software requirements and determine feasibility within time and cost constraints.
Familiar with large software system, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of the design.
Research experience by developing mathematics models and algorithms for data analysis and performance improvement.


Skills

Can observe and respond to people and situations and interact with others encountered in the course of work.
Can learn and apply new information or skills.
Must be able to read and interpret data, information, and documents.
Strong customer focus and commitment to customer satisfaction through prioritization, quality, efficiency and professionalism.
Ability to complete assignments with attention to detail and high degree of accuracy.
Proven ability to perform effectively in a demanding environment with changing workloads.
Result driven-demonstrate ownership and accountability.
Identifies bottlenecks and drives improvements.
Work independently or as part of a team and follow through on assignments with minimal supervision.
Demonstrate open, clear, concise and professional communication.
Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with co-workers and customer.
Work according to a strict set of procedures within the provided timelines.

job_detail:

We Planning & Control team is under the Regional Customer Support Operations Support department, driving the long-term operational strategy, execution and performance from the current to the targeted states to transcend the level of operation. The team members consist of Capacity Planners and 8+ Service Coordinators (managed by Team Lead) to cover TW CS all sites.

The team’s job mission focuses on the following: · Shape & Drive at external operational teams · Share and Support at internal OPS department · Quality of Service Order auditing from simple to complex level · Efficiency of Service Order handshake (to final closure) process

Role and responsibilities

The Service Coordinator have tasks in below domains: 

Shape & Drive at external
	Drive CS manager on controlling indices such as time writing (pending hours, weekly 60hr violation, monthly OT 46hr violation), Utilization Rate, old Open Service Order (>90days), etc.
	Report out in OPS dept. meeting and other segment meetings about above indices.
	Drive CS engineer on time writing timely release, frequent errors and SO incorrect booking reduction, and other agreed scopes. 
	KT & first line support to both CS manager and engineer on, eg. time writing, MHO, SAP functionalities; collect and provide user feedback (issues, improvements) to dev. teams. 
	Drive Account Team on lead time of signing or renewing commercial contracts, OSO definition (billable or not) and DST agreement and prep, and other agreed scopes.

Share and Support at internal 
	Involve in building Best Knowledge Method (BKM) on any of the above goals, eg. share, clarify, coordinate, lead in eg. internal meetings; act on BKM’s implementation.  
	Raise voice of frustration, help needed.
	When needed, flexibly support other Service Coordinators or team’s emerging tasks, eg. KT to new SCs.

Quality
	Process non-billable and billable SO with accurate data and correct hand-shake owner to avoid rework in later stage; knowledge about right data source.
	Handle SO issue, correction, trouble-shooting; feedback on structural issues and indicate correct solution owner.

Efficiency 
	Standardize work overview and productivity.
	Be able to foresee workload and complexity, plan ahead, and raise hands in case help needed.  


Education and experience
Bachelor degree

MS Excel and other data tooling capability. Good command of English. Work experiences in IT, data analytics for manufacturing section preferred. SAP experience preferred. 1+ year within ASML Customer Support organization preferred

job_name: Manufacturing - Material Planning Project Lead - Tainan - J-00265401-982
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
Factory material planning management provide services to manufacturing on material supply continuity and inefficient inventory reduction in Tainan factory. To manage the market dynamics (demand) as well as long supply chain (Lead Time), the flexibility, passion and out of box things are the most important elements in leading this organization. Material Planner is the main interface on connecting the suppliers and manufacturing in the value chain of ASML supply chain. It is important to understand ASML global supply chain operation and create collaboration working model cross-factories to secure TNF (Tainan Factory) output and enhance the way of working continuously. The role is to manage material supply and control inventory in TNF.

Role and responsibilities
1. Control inventory and reduce inefficient inventory in TNF thru collaborating with the stakeholders in different departments and functions.
2. Lead project and establish a closed-loop process to manage material supply and optimize inventory.
3. Build up intelligent mechanism to early detect issues on material supply and inventory.
4. Achieve the assigned program for facilitating the KPI on the entire Material Operation group.
5. Explore any potential opportunity to reduce inventory turnover days and provide solution.
6. Travel to oversea to work with the colleagues in local for enabling assigned programs.

Education and experience
Bachelor or above with major in Industrial Engineering, Business Administrative and Supply Chain Management related.
1. 3 to 5 years in program management, motivating and influencing dynamic matrix teams and cross functions.
2. Supply Chain management expertise in material planning, inventory control and trouble shooting.
3. Global semiconductor or high-tech company experience with frequent engagement with global stakeholders would be a plus.

Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

a. Good business sense with professional presentation skill
b. Excellent social and communication skills
c. Experience with working in multi-cultural environment
d. Able to manage fast pace and dynamic change environment
e. Familiar with ERP; Oracle and/or SAP experience is preferred
f. Fluent in English & Mandarin
g. Good peers’ network as an added advantage

Diversity & Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

12. 進行各分包廠商完成工程之驗收與結算。

job_name: 日時茶飲 南科創始店工讀人員
cust_name: 沃德維普企業社
job_detail:
日時的團隊與理念
日時茶飲專門店為台日合資品牌，日時團隊籌備近兩年，我們改變了傳統飲料店的經營模式，我們將茶飲更融入了生活中，日時茶飲結合了特色小食、商務咖啡及生活美學，讓「茶飲不再只是茶飲」。

日時茶飲正式成立於2019年，以台南府城及東京古都為雙起點，以台灣達人與日本職人的精神為品牌經營理念，在品質、原料、包裝、設計、服務甚至到加盟夥伴，日時將以最嚴格的標準為消費者把關，達成重質不重量。 

工作內容：
1.負責點餐及製作餐點給客人 
2.負責店內環境維護與商品管理 
3.協助店長完成交代事項 
4.外送協助,後場備料

job_name: 2023研發替代役_品保工程師_竹/南科
cust_name: 聯電_聯華電子股份有限公司
job_detail:
【製程品保工程師】
規劃及執行FAB生產製程管制相關統計分析技術應用, 並監督相關製程能力改善指標, 以協助FAB掌握製程改善方向, 並提供客戶所需產品生產過程相關品質資訊
規劃與推行統計製程管制系統(In-line SPC, WAT SPC, EQ SPC, etc.) , 協助FAB能順利應用於製程管理,並監督系統執行之有效性
規劃與推行Advance WAT Control 系統, 協助FAB有效篩選可能有品質風險之產品, 以更嚴謹Criteria決定產品處置,以期降低公司與客戶品質Loss Cost, 並督導系統執行之有效性
規劃與推行MRB(Material Review Board)系統, 協助FAB以Cross-function委員會方式嚴謹Review發生於製程異常之Waive產品,以期降低公司與客戶品質Loss Cost, 並督導系統執行之有效性
規劃與推行IEAR (Internal Early Alert Report)配合Fab推行Excursion Reduction Program以期Reduce internal/external failure cost, Improve engineer's sensitivity for abnormal event
協助Fab及RA執行process qualification and WEL & conformance monitor

【出貨品保工程師】 
協助主管執行出貨檢驗所需之技術與設備，並對產品品質問題進行分析與改善，以確保出貨檢驗的品質，符合客戶需求並提高客戶滿意度
負責 QA 檢驗機台程式之建立與調整，以確保檢驗品質並滿足客戶之需求
異常產品管制與處理及後續追蹤均能有效控管並防止再發
負責 QA 檢驗機台保養與異常排除，以確保出貨檢驗順暢
處理客戶訴怨VOC,CAR 跟催與拜訪/稽核之相關事宜
提昇DL人員檢驗品質
協助處理客戶品質特殊需求

job_name: Technical Project Manager
cust_name: IMS_奧地利商艾美斯電子束科技有限公司
job_detail:
• You manage deliveries of our electron multi-beam tools together with our customers who are the most advanced companies in the semiconductor industry.
• You are the direct responsible contact for the technical teams at the customer and work with them on issues with our mask writer.
• You are using your technical knowledge to coordinate solution finding together with technical experts in IMS, and you update the customer and IMS management on status and next steps.
• You are involved in high priority situations and proactively report project status, timelines, and problems.
• You form an important communication interface to the project team and relevant stakeholders.
• You are contributing to quality initiatives (Failure Analyses, 8D Reports) and process improvements for tool deliveries.
major: 物理學相關 材料工程相關 光電工程相關
language: 英文:聽 /精通、說 /精通、讀 /精通、寫 /精通
other:
• You have minimum 5 years of related work experience and completed technical or scientific education in the fields of electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, physics or similar.
• A solid understanding in optics, lithography and mask making is required.
• Knowledge of fundamental Project Management methods (Gantt Chart, Mile Stone Trend analysis, Project Reporting) is required.

job_detail:
★我們的每日工作日常:
1.世界No.1自動化搬送設備系統的設備保養(初階) 、設備維修(中階)、設備安裝(高階)。
2.掌控時程。偕同承包商執行設備保養並確實掌握作業日程。包含:
作業前-聯絡相關人員基本作業預定；作業中-指派工作項目與協調人力配置；作業後-確認實際發生費用及申請。
3. 與客戶保持良好雙向溝通、協調。以專業服務客戶的諮詢。
作業前-計畫、安排停機時程與確認、辦理進廠規定；作業中-協調廠區內作業並報告進展；作業後-確認運作狀況並提供完成報告。
4. 重視跨部門合作。協同工程單位，共同處理設備安裝與調整。

※工作待遇依個人經歷及專長等條件核定，如相關經歷豐富可議更優渥薪資。歡迎熱愛學習、喜歡挑戰高科技產業的夥伴加入，這裡將會是你最棒的舞臺!

★部門目標:
為了讓設備系統可以不間斷地生產與運作，我們已經持續37年以上，提供全台灣的客戶完整的售後服務。其中，有計劃性的保養作業，也有充滿挑戰的維修、異常排除作業。
不僅是要維持客戶對我們的高度信任，我們計畫於2-5年內將教育訓練內容更加標準化及數位化，以提升整個團隊的專業、建立更優質的售後服務團隊。
我們需要你加入我們，一起來完成這個目標。
我們歡迎你提出不受侷限的想法，結合前輩們成熟的技能，共同完成這個目標。

cust_name: 台灣大福高科技設備股份有限公司
job_detail:
★我們的每日工作日常:
1.世界No.1的自動化搬送設備系統的裝機→調機→試機→上線，致力於企業自動化發展與產線穩定運作。
2. 重視安全。在導入過程，作好相關安全措施，於4米~8米高空作業。
3.重視專案時程掌控。持續累積豐富實戰經驗，確實掌控專案各階段里程碑，全力以赴，確保設備系統準時上線。
4.重視團隊合作。協調、管理各下包商，夥同作業，掌握專案進度。
5.與客戶及工廠端保持雙向溝通、協調。以專業服務客戶。

※另設有工事津貼。
※工作待遇依個人經歷及專長等條件核定，如相關經歷豐富可議更優渥薪資。歡迎熱愛學習、喜歡挑戰高科技產業的夥伴加入，這裡將會是你最棒的舞臺!

★部門目標:
我們持續地協助半導體工廠自動化的建設，也包含了液晶廠內已導入設備的生產線改造工程。
我們要完成半導體大廠的先進製程工廠建置.2-3年內會完成3奈米的生產工廠完成,並且投入生產。
透過你加入我們團隊，確實地管理專案的人、事、物，方能順利將大福頂尖的自動化設備系統導入，完成專案。

job_name: 面板設計工程師
cust_name: 瀚宇彩晶股份有限公司
job_detail:
About the job
我們研究先進技術，開發新型態材料，執行光學、layout設計並進行issue解析以及佈局專利，建立核心專利技術門檻。 
我們不滿足於現狀，鼓勵持續創新及突破，正在尋找具備專業知識技術與充滿熱情的您一同接軌世界。


Responsibilities
•執行產品設計，產品issue解析。
•新產品開發專案管理、執行新製程技術發展。
•研究先進技術、開發新材料。
•改進產品品質製程技術，以達成良率改善或製程能力提升。
•完成產品驗證評價作業。

Qualifications
•光電工程、物理、電機電子工程學士學位以上。
•2年以上LCD工作經驗者，熟悉佈局軟體(Laker)、GIP (GOA or IGD)電路設計及開發。

Traits
•創新實踐
•挑戰突破
•發現問題、解決問題
•主動積極

job_name: 技術服務工程師(車載產品)_台南
cust_name: GARMIN_台灣國際航電股份有限公司
job_detail:
【部門說明】
車用電子領域為當前全球發展的主要潮流，Garmin車用電子事業群已深耕多年，具備多樣的產品線及完善的團隊陣容，為國際車廠客戶提供優質的產品及卓越的服務為主要目標。歡迎加入我們!

在這裡工作可以學習到：
1. 與全球汽車產業接軌，瞭解各車廠版圖分佈、供應鏈及未來趨勢
2. 認識歐美中日，不同國際車廠體系，及其對於產品開發、品質及服務嚴格要求
3. 瞭解Garmin車用電子產品的創新科技、產品實現過程及生產製造技術
4. 掌握汽車電子領域第一線市場狀況，磨練策略性思考，實現高客戶滿意
5. 與國外客戶及Garmin同事共事，拓展國際視野

【工作範圍】
1.	Able to understand customer’s needs and clearly describe the issues that customer is facing to internal stakeholders
2.	Able to do equipment troubleshooting to let customer’s production run smoothly
3.	Cooperate with engineering team to troubleshoot hardware, solve complex problems, and make equipment & product work better
4.	Able work and coordinate across departments to drive for progress and solution
5.	Able to present and report clearly during internal and external meetings.
6.	Work shift rotation and work in a clean room environment during customer’s production period
major: 數學及電算機科學學科類 工程學科類 工業技藝及機械學科類

other:

【其他條件】
1.	Bachelor or above degree in engineering, science or management field 
2.	Excellent English in speaking and writing 
3.	 Must have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills 
4.	Measurements in electric circuits 
5.	Practical experience in root cause analysis using tools, 8D or any similar approach 
6.	Working experience in Automotive industry is a plus
